txt.en: 'Broken, yet not destroyed.'
'Laerdan, my friend, seek not for the ring Narchuil.'
'And what other councils I wonder were revealed in his torment.'
'It cannot ease your sorrow.'
''You will never see Narmeleth free of the evil that consumes her.'
'I am not.'
'The council can not continue without Laerdan. I will speak with you privately in my library [placeholder].'
'Come forward, [placeholder], The fate of the ring Narchuil concerns you as well.'
'You all know why this council has been called.'
'Laerdan, you will now give the full account of your deeds concerning Narchuil.'
'Alas, he perished in the rescue of Arvedui.'
'Laerdan, we are grateful at your return but you have much to answer for.'
'The ring-half he bore is now lost to icy northern waters.'
Half of Narchuil has been recovered, and you must attend a council called by Elrond to discuss the fate of the ring and to consider Laerdan's actions.
'Speak now of the breaking of Narchuil and the imprisonment of Amarthiel.'
'Long were the tortures I endured in Sammath Baul, but in the end I revealed what they sought.'
'I do not wish more suffering upon you Laerdan, but I will have the tale told.'
'That for long years half of the ring lay hidden in Bar-e-therchir.'
'You are among friends, Laerdan, and we must know the full account.'
'I remember nothing more, until I awoke here and was summoned to this council.'
'Laerdan is a guest, not a prisoner.'
'If only I had not broken the ring!'
'Still, I am filled with unease at his words.  I fear that his oath will only lead to sorrow.'
'Were it still whole I could turn its power to curing my Narmeleth.'
'And what do you know of grief?'
'And where now lies the other half of the ring?'
'For too long you have sat here in splendour and it has made you soft.'
'Would you force the tale from me?  I believed I was free of such torment.'
'Are you content to watch all of Eriador fall into ruin?'
'But it matters not, the ring Narchuil will never be remade.'
'Very well then, Master Elrond.'
'I take upon myself this oath;'
'It was before the broken gates of Fornost that I took the ring from Amarthiel.'
'That I should not find rest or peace until my Narmeleth is returned to me.'
'In my haste I broke it upon the anvil Dringond, mightiest of the forges of the Dúnedain.'
'By the name of Elbereth I swear it!
'Indeed.  Breaking the ring did not remove the malice crafted into it.'
'If Elrond Halfelven refuses to aid me I must then rely upon Aignel and Ningarch.'
'I escaped with Narmeleth to Sithad, but still the ring held sway over her.'
'Before she could be cured she was discovered by the Enemy.'
'It was in the keeping of my friend Aearil:  mighty among the ship-captains of Círdan.'
Attend the Council of Narchuil
'Master Elrond, will you allow this departure?!'
'Mordirith returned her to Carn Dûm, but the halves of Narchuil remained hidden.'
Attend the Council of Narchuil.
'How, then, did the enemy recover this half of the ring?'
'You claim that it will never be remade...I would have you tell how you know this as a fact.'
'I will not remain idle here in Imladris, soon I will seek for the northward roads...'
'I fear what deeds may be done now that Laerdan has returned.'
Instance: Half-truths
